demo_value.investor_story: The Galapagos Marine Reserve is the gold standard for marine conservation - a NEOLI 5/5 site spanning 198,000 km2 with the unique convergence of coral, kelp, and mangrove habitats. Generating $321M/year in ecosystem services dominated by $275M in tourism, the Galapagos demonstrates that fully protected marine reserves are among the world's most valuable natural assets. With 1.8M tonnes of carbon stored in its mangroves and emerging blue economy programs, the reserve exemplifies the financial case for marine protection at scale. Nereus rates the Galapagos AAA - the reference standard for marine natural capital.
